title: How to Make Apple Pie Oatmeal

steps.headline: Pour as much oatmeal as you'd like into a microwave-safe bowl.
steps.description: If you're not sure how much that is, start with about half a cup.

steps.headline: Pour water into the bowl so it generously covers the oatmeal.
steps.description: If you're measuring, use as much water as oatmeal, half a cup.

steps.headline: Add a pinch of salt.
steps.description: It won't make your oatmeal taste salty, don't worry. It will enhance the taste of the whole thing and make it less bland.

steps.headline: Microwave the oatmeal and water right there in the bowl for a minute or two.
steps.description: The oatmeal will absorb most or all the water and puff up.

steps.headline: Spoon about a tablespoon of brown sugar over the oatmeal.
steps.description: You can use the same spoon that you'll use to eat the oatmeal. If you're using sweetened applesauce, use less sugar.

steps.headline: Put applesauce on the oatmeal, still using that same spoon.
steps.description: If you'd like to measure, aim for a quarter cup. By eye, it should look like a thick layer of frosting.

steps.headline: If you have them and like them, add tiny sprinkles of ground nutmeg, cloves, and allspice.
If you have it, add about a tablespoon of orange juice or dried orange peel.
Mix everything, microwave it for a few more seconds if you'd like it any warmer, and enjoy.

text: Pour as much oatmeal as you'd like into a microwave-safe bowl. If you're not sure how much that is, start with about half a cup. Pour water into the bowl so it generously covers the oatmeal. If you're measuring, use as much water as oatmeal, half a cup. Add a pinch of salt. It won't make your oatmeal taste salty, don't worry. It will enhance the taste of the whole thing and make it less bland. Microwave the oatmeal and water right there in the bowl for a minute or two. The oatmeal will absorb most or all the water and puff up. Spoon about a tablespoon of brown sugar over the oatmeal. You can use the same spoon that you'll use to eat the oatmeal. If you're using sweetened applesauce, use less sugar. Put applesauce on the oatmeal, still using that same spoon. If you'd like to measure, aim for a quarter cup. By eye, it should look like a thick layer of frosting. Sprinkle on some cinnamon.  If you have them and like them, add tiny sprinkles of ground nutmeg, cloves, and allspice.  If you have it, add about a tablespoon of orange juice or dried orange peel.  Mix everything, microwave it for a few more seconds if you'd like it any warmer, and enjoy.  Finished.
